title: Bumble founder gets £4m dividend ahead of potential float
text:
Matchmaking chief executive Whitney Wolfe Herd of women-focused dating app Bumble enjoyed a £4m dividend ahead of a possible float for the firm's parent company.

The 30-year-old US executive secured the windfall as part of £20m of dividends paid out by the profitable UK arm of Bumble, a major rival to Match Group’s Tinder.

Bumble has grown to tens of millions of users for its female-first app, which lets women make the first move when they match with potential dates on its swipe-left-swipe-right service.

Meanwhile, revenues at parent firm Badoo, a dating conglomerate owned by Russian matchmaking magnate Andrey Andreev, skyrocketed to £270m in the year ending December, up 51pc from £180m last...
